content:
# Source Language
English

# Target Language
Japanese

# Target Word
glacier

# Text Fragment
The ancient glacier carved the valley over centuries

# Paragraph Context
The valley was deep and narrow. <fragment>The ancient <target>glacier</target> carved the valley over centuries.</fragment> Streams now flow where the ice once stood.
{"word_translation":"氷河","fragment_translation":"古代の氷河が何世紀にもわたりその谷を刻んだ"}

# Source Language
English

# Target Language
Japanese

# Target Word
hesitate

# Dictionary Definition
Verb: to pause before doing something, often because of uncertainty

# Text Fragment
He did not hesitate before stepping forward

# Paragraph Context
He took a breath. <fragment>He did not <target>hesitate</target> before stepping forward.</fragment> The crowd watched quietly.
{"word_translation":"ためらう","fragment_translation":"彼は一歩踏み出す前にためらわなかった"}

# Source Language
English

# Target Language
Japanese

# Target Word
shoreline

# Text Fragment
We walked along the rocky shoreline at dawn

# Paragraph Context
The tide was slowly rising. <fragment>We walked along the rocky <target>shoreline</target> at dawn.</fragment> Birds called above us.
{"word_translation":"海岸線","fragment_translation":"夜明けに私たちは岩の多い海岸線を歩いた"}
